text: Eupterote petola is a moth in the family Eupterotidae. It was described by Moore in 1860. It is found on Java.Butterflies & Moths of the World - Generic Names and their Type-species The wingspan is 60–65 mm for males and 65–70 mm for females. The wings are yellow, crossed by parallel dark bands. The basal area is dark greyish-brown to bluish black-brown.De Heterocera van Sumatra VI ==References== Category:Moths described in 1860 Category:Eupterotinae
title: Eupterote petola
